sen.j: 幕の内弁当（まくのうちべんとう）とは、白飯と数種類の副食（おかず）からなる弁当。
sen.e: Makunouchi-bento is a type of bento (lunch box) with white rice and several accompanying dishes.
Makunouchi-bento is a type of bento (lunch box) with white rice and several accompanying dishes.
Makunouchi-bento is a type of bento (lunch box) with white rice and several accompanying dishes.

sen.j: ただし、この言葉は数百年の歴史を持っているため、細かな定義や特徴については諸説ある。
sen.e: As the word "Makunouchi-bento" has a history of several hundred years, there are various theories as to its detailed definition and features.
As the word "Makunouchi-bento" has a history of several hundred years, there are various theories as to its detailed definition and features.
As the word "Makunouchi-bento" has a history of several hundred years, there are various theories as to its detailed definition and features.

sen.j: 歴史
sen.e: History
History
History

sen.j: 弁当そのものの歴史は古く、外出時の食事として持参するものと定義するならば、その起源はわからない。
sen.e: The history of bento themselves is long, and if a bento is defined as meals to go, its origin is not known.
The history of bento themselves is long, and if a bento is defined as meals to go, its origin is not known.
The history of bento themselves is long, and if a bento is defined as meals to go, its origin is not known.

sen.j: なお記録としては、日本では遅くとも5世紀頃にはそういった習慣があったとされている。
sen.e: Records show that there was such a practice in Japan in the fifth century at the latest.
Records show that there was such a practice in Japan in the fifth century at the latest.
Records show that there was such a practice in Japan in the fifth century at the latest.

sen.j: 白飯と副食という組み合わせの弁当についても、その起源は不明である。
sen.e: The origin of bento with white rice and accompanying dishes is not clear, either.
The origin of bento with white rice and accompanying dishes is not clear, either.
The origin of bento with white rice and accompanying dishes is not clear, either.

sen.j: 白飯と副食という組み合わせの、単なるおにぎりなどと比べると手のこんだ弁当が「幕の内弁当」と呼ばれるようになったのは、江戸時代中期とされている。
sen.e: It is considered to be the mid Edo period that people started to call the bento consisting of white rice and accompanying dishes, which is more well-prepared than just rice balls, "Makunouchi-bento."
It is considered to be the mid Edo period that people started to call the bento consisting of white rice and accompanying dishes, which is more well-prepared than just rice balls, 'Makunouchi-bento.'
sen.cmt: シングルクォーテーションに変更
sen.e: It is considered to be the mid Edo period that people started to call the bento consisting of white rice and accompanying dishes, which is more well-prepared than just rice balls, 'Makunouchi-bento.'

sen.j: この頃、料亭などの原型が成立し弁当を製造販売するようになった。
sen.e: It was around this time that the original form of Japanese-style restaurants were established and started to prepare and sell bento.
It was around this time that the original form of Japanese-style restaurants was established and they started to prepare and sell bento.
sen.cmt: were→wasに修正、started→they startedとしました。
sen.e: It was around this time that the original form of Japanese-style restaurants was established and they started to prepare and sell bento.

sen.j: それらは芝居などの観客にも向けられ、芝居茶屋などと呼ばれる観客を接待する店舗にも提供された。
sen.e: They targeted audiences who came to see theatrical plays as well and their bento were provided to the places for entertaining guests such as tea houses called Shibai jaya which are located inside theaters.

They targeted audiences who came to see theatrical plays as well and their bento were provided to the places for entertaining guests such as tea houses called Shibai jaya which were located inside theaters.

They targeted audiences who came to see theatrical plays as well and their bento were provided to the places for entertaining guests such as tea houses called Shibai jaya which were located inside theaters.

sen.j: それらの弁当は、芝居の幕間（まくあい）・幕の内に観客が食べるものなので、いつしか「幕の内弁当」と呼ばれるようになったとされる。
sen.e: The bento were eaten during the intermission, makuai or makunouchi in Japanese, which resulted in the name "Makunouchi-bento."
The bento were eaten during the intermission, makuai or makunouchi in Japanese, which resulted in the name 'Makunouchi-bento.'
sen.cmt: シングルクォーテーションに変更
sen.e: The bento were eaten during the intermission, makuai or makunouchi in Japanese, which resulted in the name 'Makunouchi-bento.'

sen.j: これ以外にも、「幕の内側で役者が食べるから」という説もある。
sen.e: There are other explanations for the origin of the name: one is that makunouchi means "behind curtains," describing where actors ate their bento.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: There are other explanations for the origin of the name: one is that makunouchi means 'behind curtains,' describing where actors ate their bento.
sen.cmt: シングルクォーテーションに変更
sen.e: There are other explanations for the origin of the name: one is that makunouchi means 'behind curtains,' describing where actors ate their bento.

sen.j: また、「相撲取りの小結が幕の内力士であることから小さなおむすびの入っている弁当を幕の内弁当と呼ぶようになった」などの説も存在する。
sen.e: Another is that as Komusubi (a sumo wrestler of the fourth highest rank) is one of Makuuchi (wrestlers in the senior division,) people came to call the bento with small rice balls (which can be called Komusubi in Japanese) Makunouchi-bento.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処小さなおむすびと小結の関係をはっきりさせるため、おむすびの後に説明を追加しました。
sen.e: Another is that as Komusubi (a sumo wrestler of the fourth highest rank) is one of Makunouchi-rikishi (wrestlers in the senior division), people came to call the bento with small rice balls (which can be called Komusubi in Japanese) Makunouchi-bento.
sen.cmt: Makuuchi→Makunouchi-rikishiとし、カンマの位置を移動
sen.e: Another is that as Komusubi (a sumo wrestler of the fourth highest rank) is one of Makunouchi-rikishi (wrestlers in the senior division), people came to call the bento with small rice balls (which can be called Komusubi in Japanese) Makunouchi-bento.

sen.j: 平行して相撲の観客に対しても相撲茶屋が同様の弁当を供し、そこから幕内力士のように相撲の世界にも幕の内という言葉が持ち込まれたという説もあるが、こちらにも異論がある。
sen.e: There is an opposing theory that as sumo-jaya (sumo teahouse) served similar kinds of bento to the sumo audiences, the word "makunouchi" was brought to the world of sumo such as Makuuchi-rikishi (wrestlers in the elite makuuchi division,) but objections exist to this theory, too.

There is an opposing theory that as sumo-jaya (sumo teahouse) served similar kinds of bento to the sumo audiences, the word "makunouchi" was brought to the world of sumo such as Makunouchi-rikishi, but objections exist to this theory, too.
sen.cmt: 表記統一のため、Makuuchi-rikishi→Makunouchi-rikishiとし、補足削除、カンマの位置を移動
sen.e: There is an opposing theory that as sumo-jaya (sumo teahouse) served similar kinds of bento to the sumo audiences, the word "makunouchi" was brought to the world of sumo such as Makunouchi-rikishi, but objections exist to this theory, too.

sen.j: 容器は、現在のものに類似した使い捨てのできる経木の折詰もあったが、重箱などで供されることが多かった。
sen.e: Containers such as tiered food boxes were frequently used to serve Makunouchi-bento, but also used were disposable boxes made of paper-thin sheets of wood like the ones of the present time.
Containers such as tiered food boxes were frequently used to serve Makunouchi-bento, but also used were disposable boxes made of paper-thin sheets of wood like the ones of the present time.
Containers such as tiered food boxes were frequently used to serve Makunouchi-bento, but also used were disposable boxes made of paper-thin sheets of wood like the ones of the present time.

sen.j: 明治以降になってからは、幕の内弁当は駅弁の様式のひとつとして広まった。
sen.e: After the Meiji period, Makunouchi-bento spread as one style of Ekiben (a bento sold on a train or at a station).
After the Meiji period, Makunouchi-bento spread as one style of ekiben (a bento sold on a train or at a station).
sen.cmt: 表記統一のため、Ekiben→ekibenとしました。
sen.e: After the Meiji period, Makunouchi-bento spread as one style of ekiben (a bento sold on a train or at a station).

sen.j: この駅弁としての弁当は、容器の回収ができないことから、使い捨ての経木の折詰に盛るという方法が一気に広まったとされる。
sen.e: Being sold as an ekiben meant that containers could not be collected, which contributed to the rapid spread of using disposable paper-thin wood boxes.
Being sold as an ekiben meant that containers could not be collected, which contributed to the rapid spread of using disposable paper-thin wood boxes.
Being sold as an ekiben meant that containers could not be collected, which contributed to the rapid spread of using disposable paper-thin wood boxes.

sen.j: ただし、幕の内弁当が弁当の典型的・代表的な存在であったことから、必ずしも「幕の内弁当」で呼ばれるとは限らず、単に「弁当」「御弁当」などと呼ばれることも多かった。
sen.e: However, as a Makunouchi-bento was the typical and standard type of bento, people did not always call it "Makunouchi-bento," but just called it bento or obento, a boxed lunch.
However, as a Makunouchi-bento was the typical and standard type of bento, people did not always call it 'Makunouchi-bento,' but just called it bento or obento, a boxed lunch.
sen.cmt: シングルクォーテーションに変更
sen.e: However, as a Makunouchi-bento was the typical and standard type of bento, people did not always call it 'Makunouchi-bento,' but just called it bento or obento, a boxed lunch.

sen.j: 駅弁は、20世紀末期から地方色が強いもの、特定の食材を重視したものなどへの傾斜を深めたが、幕の内も依然根強い人気がある。
sen.e: In the late 20th century, ekiben tended to feature local specialties as well as specific ingredients but Makunouchi-bento remain popular.
In the late 20th century, ekiben tended to feature local specialties as well as specific ingredients but Makunouchi-bento remain popular.
In the late 20th century, ekiben tended to feature local specialties as well as specific ingredients but Makunouchi-bento remain popular.

sen.j: コンビニエンスストアなどでも弁当が売られるようになり、その中で幕の内弁当は一定の勢力を維持している。
sen.e: Now bento are available at convenience stores and Makunouchi-bento make up a certain part of the section.
Now bento are available at convenience stores and Makunouchi-bento make up a certain part of the section.
Now bento are available at convenience stores and Makunouchi-bento make up a certain part of the section.

sen.j: 幕の内弁当は、地味ではあるが弁当界の本流として、現在も生き続けている。
sen.e: Makunouchi-bento, although inconspicuous, continue to be appreciated as the mainstream of the boxed lunch.
Makunouchi-bento, although inconspicuous, continue to be appreciated as the mainstream of the boxed lunch.
Makunouchi-bento, although inconspicuous, continue to be appreciated as the mainstream of the boxed lunch.

sen.j: おおまかな定義
sen.e: Basic Definition
Basic Definition
Basic Definition

sen.j: ご飯は、一般に白飯である。
sen.e: Generally, white rice is used.
Generally, white rice is used.
Generally, white rice is used.

sen.j: 炊き込みご飯・まぜご飯などを使ったものを幕の内弁当に分類するかどうかについては説が分かれる。
sen.e: There are different opinions on whether to categorize bento with takikomi-gohan (rice cooked with other ingredients) or maze-gohan (cooked rice with added ingredients) as Makunouchi-bento.
There are different opinions on whether to categorize bento with takikomi-gohan (rice cooked with other ingredients) or maze-gohan (cooked rice with added ingredients) as Makunouchi-bento.
There are different opinions on whether to categorize bento with takikomi-gohan (rice cooked with other ingredients) or maze-gohan (cooked rice with added ingredients) as Makunouchi-bento.

sen.j: ご飯は、俵型のおにぎりが並べて詰められゴマ（主に黒胡麻）を散らしたものが本来の幕の内とされる。
sen.e: A traditional Makunouchi-bento has barrel-shaped rice balls sprinkled with sesame (mainly black sesame) lining inside the box.
A traditional Makunouchi-bento has barrel-shaped rice balls sprinkled with sesame (mainly black sesame) lining inside the box.
A traditional Makunouchi-bento has barrel-shaped rice balls sprinkled with sesame (mainly black sesame) lining inside the box.

sen.j: これは握り飯の名残であるといわれている。
sen.e: The reason for this is probably because it started with rice balls.
The reason for this is probably because it started with rice balls.
The reason for this is probably because it started with rice balls.

sen.j: ただし現在では、実際に個別のおにぎりが詰められている場合は少なく、型押しをして俵型に見せていることが多く、白飯の上に黒胡麻や海苔や佃煮などを散らしたものもある。
sen.e: Recently, Makunouchi-bento with real rice balls are rarities, as they usually have white rice embossed with a barrel-like shape and sometimes sprinkled with black sesame, dried seaweed or tsukudani (small fish, shellfish, konbu, etc. boiled in sweetened soy sauce) and so on.

Recently, Makunouchi-bento with real rice balls are rarities, as they usually have white rice embossed with a barrel-like shape and sometimes sprinkled with black sesame, dried seaweed or tsukudani (small fish, shellfish, konbu, etc. boiled in sweetened soy sauce) and so on.

Recently, Makunouchi-bento with real rice balls are rarities, as they usually have white rice embossed with a barrel-like shape and sometimes sprinkled with black sesame, dried seaweed or tsukudani (small fish, shellfish, konbu, etc. boiled in sweetened soy sauce) and so on.

sen.j: おかずは、汁気のないものを少しずついろいろ詰め合わせるのが一般的である。
sen.e: Makunouchi-bento usually have a varied assortment of accompanying dishes, which do not contain much moisture, each in a small amount.
Makunouchi-bento usually have a varied assortment of accompanying dishes, which do not contain much moisture, each in a small amount.
Makunouchi-bento usually have a varied assortment of accompanying dishes, which do not contain much moisture, each in a small amount.

sen.j: 特に焼き魚・玉子焼き・蒲鉾（以上の3つを総称して幕の内弁当三種の神器とも）・揚げ物・漬物･煮物は大半の幕の内弁当に入れられており、幕の内弁当の代表的なおかずであるといえる。
sen.e: In particular, broiled fish, a Japanese style omelet, kamaboko or fish sausage (the above together are sometimes called the three sacred imperial treasures of Makunouchi-bento), a deep fried dish, Japanese pickles and boiled and seasoned food can be seen in many Makunouchi-bento as they are the typical accompanying dishes of Makunouchi-bento.

In particular, broiled fish, a Japanese style omelet, kamaboko or fish sausage (the above together are sometimes called the three sacred imperial treasures of Makunouchi-bento), deep-fried food, Japanese pickles and boiled and seasoned food can be seen in many Makunouchi-bento as they are the typical accompanying dishes of Makunouchi-bento.
sen.cmt: a deep fried dish→deep-fried foodとしました。
sen.e: In particular, broiled fish, a Japanese style omelet, kamaboko or fish sausage (the above together are sometimes called the three sacred imperial treasures of Makunouchi-bento), deep-fried food, Japanese pickles and boiled and seasoned food can be seen in many Makunouchi-bento as they are the typical accompanying dishes of Makunouchi-bento.

sen.j: またハンバーグやオムレツ、ソーセージなどを織り込んだものは洋風幕の内と呼称されることが多い。
sen.e: Those with a hamburger, an omelet or sausage are often called Western style Makunouchi-bento.
Those with a hamburger, an omelet or sausage are often called Western style Makunouchi-bento.
Those with a hamburger, an omelet or sausage are often called Western style Makunouchi-bento.

sen.j: 特徴のある地方色の強い料理や豪華な料理をおかずとして盛る場合には、その特徴のある料理の名などを冠して「○○弁当」などと呼ばれることが多いが、それらの中にも実態としては幕の内弁当に分類できるものが珍しくない。
sen.e: Some bento feature local specialties or luxurious food as accompanying dishes and are often named after these featuring dishes, but in reality, they can often be categorized as Makunouchi-bento.
Some bento feature local specialties or luxurious food as accompanying dishes and are often named after these featuring dishes, but in reality, they can often be categorized as Makunouchi-bento.
Some bento feature local specialties or luxurious food as accompanying dishes and are often named after these featuring dishes, but in reality, they can often be categorized as Makunouchi-bento.

sen.j: ごはんとおかずを組み合わせた類似の弁当として、他に松花堂弁当がある。
sen.e: Shokado-bento have a similar style with a combination of white rice and accompanying dishes.
Shokado-bento have a similar style with a combination of white rice and accompanying dishes.
Shokado-bento have a similar style with a combination of white rice and accompanying dishes.

sen.j: しかし松花堂弁当は昭和初期に開発された最近の様式の弁当である。
sen.e: However, Shokado-bento are a newer style bento which was developed in the early Showa period.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However, a Shokado-bento is a newer style bento which was developed in the early Showa period.
sen.cmt: Shokado-bento are→a Shokado-bento isとしました。
sen.e: However, a Shokado-bento is a newer style bento which was developed in the early Showa period.

sen.j: また幕の内弁当が本膳料理の流れを汲むものであるのに対し松花堂弁当は懐石料理（茶料理）の流れを汲むものであって、系譜は大きく異なる。
sen.e: Their origins are very much different: while the Makunouchi-bento was developed from Honzen ryori (full-course haute cuisine,) the Shokado-bento arose out of Kaiseki ryori (tea-ceremony dishes).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Their origins are very much different: while the Makunouchi-bento was developed from Honzen ryori (full-course haute cuisine), the Shokado-bento arose out of Kaiseki ryori (tea-ceremony dishes).
Their origins are very much different: while the Makunouchi-bento was developed from Honzen ryori (full-course haute cuisine), the Shokado-bento arose out of Kaiseki ryori (tea-ceremony dishes).

sen.j: もっとも、近年では単に十字の仕切りを入れた幕の内弁当に「松花堂弁当」の名をつけるなどの混同もみられる。
sen.e: However, there has lately been some confusion over the difference with people calling a Makunouchi-bento in a box with cross-shaped partitions "Shokado-bento."
However, there has lately been some confusion over the difference with people calling a Makunouchi-bento in a box with cross-shaped partitions 'Shokado-bento.'
sen.cmt: シングルクォーテーションに変更
sen.e: However, there has lately been some confusion over the difference with people calling a Makunouchi-bento in a box with cross-shaped partitions 'Shokado-bento.'
